On Thursday 16 October 2003 10:34, jain_prabhat wrote:
> Thanks Chirag & Everybody else for giving time to my problem.
>
> Although I also had guessed it and now I feel it was quite natural to
> be designed that way. What I was trying to do was before testing a
> case or cases which has a few steps transaction, so for parts of the
> transaction I was putting asserts although JUnit will fail it when it
> first finds it but the drawback is it don't tell which one so what I
> did was I changed to throw the AssertFailureException("Message") and
> I got the desired results.

You do know about `assertEquals( message, wanted, got )`, etc, don't you?

[Doesn't your development environment tell you where the failing assertion
is anyway?]
